meta.name: description
meta.content: Pinellas County Schools is the seventh largest district in Florida with 150 schools including magnets, career academies, adult education centers and our own virtual school program.

meta.content: Pinellas County Schools, PCS, Florida, Pinellas, Schools

div.label: Search Our Site

a.title: Search

li.p: Parents play a vital role in their child's academic success. Find information and resources to support your child's education.
The mission of Pinellas County Schools is to Educate and Prepare Each Student for College, Career and Life. Find information and resources to support students education.
Pinellas County Schools establishes partnerships and builds relationships between families, communities, schools and the district to support 100% student success.
As the governing body of the Pinellas County School District, the School Board is responsible for the control, operation, organization, management and administration of schools.
li.a: Visit the PCS School Board website

span.h2: School Closure and Digital Learning Update
span.p: Governor DeSantis and the Department of Education extended a directive requiring all school districts in the state of Florida to close for students for the balance of the school year. Students will continue education through digital learning. View update >

a.span: Tarpon Springs High senior a semifinalist for national award

div.p: April 16, 2020 - Alexander Theophilopoulos, Tarpon Springs High valedictorian, has been selected as a semifinalist in the Presidential Scholars Program.

img.alt: Pinellas County Schools receives national recognition for outstanding music education

a.span: Pinellas County Schools receives national recognition for outstanding music education

div.p: April 8, 2020 The NAMM Foundation has designated Pinellas County Schools as one of the 2020 Best Communities for Music Education.

a.title: Go to comments for Pinellas County Schools receives national recognition for outstanding music education

div.p: April 2, 2020 More than 460 students were recognized as PRIDE Award winners.

img.alt: Four pinellas schools earn state recognition for reducing food insecurity

a.span: Four pinellas schools earn state recognition for reducing food insecurity

div.p: March 31, 2020 - The elementary schools were awarded Hunger-Free School Campus Designations.

a.title: Go to comments for Four pinellas schools earn state recognition for reducing food insecurity

img.alt: Be a part of the transformation

a.span: Virtual interviews for Transformation Zone teachers

div.p: March 30, 2020 Pinellas County Schools is looking for teachers to lead transformational change at schools within the Zone. Virtual interviews will be held for teachers who can help change the educational lives of Transformation Zone students.

a.title: Go to comments for Virtual interviews for Transformation Zone teachers

span.h3: School counseling supervisor receives statewide recognition for leadership
span.p: Nov. 4, 2019 School Counseling Specialist Jonathan Blair was selected for the Florida School Counselor Association School Counselor Advocate: District Leader Award. Read article >

a.title: Go to comments for School counseling supervisor receives statewide recognition for leadership

span.p: Nov. 4, 2019 Carwise Middle Schools girls and Osceola Middle Schools boys volleyball teams win middle school volleyball titles. Read article >

a.title: Go to comments for Middle school volleyball champions crowned

span.h3: District teacher named state outstanding science educator
span.p: Oct. 30, 2019 Amber Robinson, a teacher at Douglas L. Jamerson, Jr. Elementary, as named the 2019 Outstanding Elementary School Educator by the Florida Association of Science Teachers. Read article >

a.title: Go to comments for District teacher named state outstanding science educator

span.h3: STEM supervisor chosen to showcase STEM programs to female STEM leaders from around the world
span.p: Oct. 29, 2019 K-12 STEM Specialist Laura Spence was selected for the honor by World Partnerships Inc. Read article >

a.title: Go to comments for STEM supervisor chosen to showcase STEM programs to female STEM leaders from around the world

span.h3: Student artwork on display at the Dunedin Fine Art Center
span.p: Oct. 29, 2019 Artwork created by 72 students was selected for the Creative Start exhibit at the art center. Read article >

a.title: Go to comments for Student artwork on display at the Dunedin Fine Art Center

span.h3: Oversight committee meets to review Referendum spending
span.p: Oct. 28, 2019 The Independent Citizens Referendum Oversight Committee meets regularly to ensure that Referendum funds are spent as voters intended. Read article >

a.title: Go to comments for Oversight committee meets to review Referendum spending
